attributes.action: ban the profiting of images and/or videos taken without consent of any person(s) going about their daily lifes or out side of a public/staged event.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is time we stop this paparazzi culture that exists here in this country before we lose another soul, like Diana. She was an amazing women that helped open up so many peoples eyes to the problems that go on all around us. Just imagine what good could have been achieved if she was still here touching our hearts today.

Now the only way I can see this happening is to stop the cause of it... money. If the photographer can't make a profit from sleeping outside a frightened young women’s house till she goes out, then why do it?? Then if the papers/magazines/TV channels aren't allowed to buy them to increase sales, then why buy them?
Now I don't mind what the law be called but I would like to see it instated before the anniversary of Diana's death, as I feel it would be fitting to know that we won't potentially lose another great humanitarian that could do so much good for this world just because some photographer pushed them over the edge of reason or caused another tragic accident.

rejection.details: Thank you however there is a similar petition that overlaps with the requested one: http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/snooping/ Please consider signing this before opening a new one.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
